[units_xml] list(Celsius, Celsius, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, temperatureItemType, None, °C, A temperature scale based on 0° for the freezing point of water and 100° for the boiling point of water at 1 atm pressure., SI, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(K, Kelvin, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, temperatureItemType, None, K, The kelvin is a unit of measure for temperature based upon an absolute scale. It is one of the seven base units in the International System of Units (SI) and is assigned the unit symbol K. The Kelvin scale is an absolute, thermodynamic temperature scale using as its null point absolute zero, the temperature at which all thermal motion ceases in the classical description of thermodynamics. The kelvin is defined as the fraction 1⁄273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water (exactly 0.01 °C or 32.018 °F). In other words, it is defined such that the triple point of water is exactly 273.16 K., SI, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(F, Fahrenheit, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, temperatureItemType, None, °F, Fahrenheit is a unit of measure for temperature defined by two fixed points: the temperature at which water freezes into ice is defined as 32 °F, and the boiling point of water is defined to be 212 °F, a 180 °F separation, as defined at sea level and standard atmospheric pressure., Customary, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(Pa, Pascal, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, pressureItemType, None, Pa, The pascal is the SI derived unit of pressure used to quantify internal pressure, stress, Young's modulus and ultimate tensile strength. It is defined as one newton per square meter., SI, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(Bar, Bar, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, pressureItemType, None, bar, The bar is a metric unit of pressure, but is not approved as part of the International System of Units (SI). It is defined as exactly equal to 100000 Pa, which is slightly less than the current average atmospheric pressure on Earth at sea level., Customary, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(psi, Pounds Per Square Inch, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, pressureItemType, None, psi, The pound per square inch is a unit of pressure or of stress based on avoirdupois units. It is the pressure resulting from a force of one pound-force applied to an area of one square inch., Customary, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(atm, Standard Atmosphere, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, pressureItemType, None, atm, The standard atmosphere is a unit of pressure defined as 101325 Pa (1.01325 bar). It is sometimes used as a reference or standard pressure., Customary, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(N, Newton, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, forceItemType, None, N, The newton is the International System of Units (SI) derived unit of force. One newton is the force needed to accelerate one kilogram of mass at the rate of one metre per second squared in direction of the applied force., SI, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(var, Volt-ampere reactive, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, powerItemType, 2009-12-16, var, In electric power transmission and distribution, volt-ampere reactive (var) is a unit by which reactive power is expressed in an AC electric power system. Reactive power is the power that is wasted and not used to do work on the load., Customary, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(VA, Volt-ampere, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, powerItemType, 2009-12-16, VA, A volt-ampere (VA) is the unit used for the apparent power in an electrical circuit, equal to the product of root-mean-square (RMS) voltage and RMS current. In direct current (DC) circuits, this product is equal to the real power (active power) in watts. Volt-amperes are useful only in the context of alternating current (AC) circuits., SI, REC, 2017-07-12) -
[units_xml] list(Wh, Watt-Hours, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, energyItemType, 2009-12-16, Wh, Watt-Hours of Energy, Customary, REC, 2017-07-12) -
[units_xml] list(VAh, Volt-ampere-hours, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, energyItemType, 2009-12-16, VAh, Volt-ampere (VA) hours of energy., Customary, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(Ah, Ampere Hours, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, electricChargeItemType, None, Ah, An ampere hour or amp hour is a unit of electric charge, equal to the charge transferred by a steady current of one ampere flowing for one hour., Customary, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(C, Coulomb, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, electricChargeItemType, None, C, The coulomb is the International System of Units (SI) unit of electric charge. It is the charge transported by a constant current of one ampere in one second., SI, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(Degree, Degree, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, planeAngleItemType, None, °, The degree is a measurement of a plane angle, defined so that a full rotation is 360 degrees. In XBRL the degree is reported in a decimal format., Customary, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(rad, Radian, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, planeAngleItemType, None, rad, The radian is the standard unit of angular measure. The radian is an SI derived unit., SI, REC, 2017-07-12) -

[units_xml] list(dth, Dekatherm, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, energyItemType, 2009-12-16, dth, The dekatherm is a unit of energy used to measure natural gas. One dekatherm is equal to 10 therms or one million British thermal units (Btu)., Customary, REC, 2021-02-16) -

[units_xml] list(MWd, Megawatt-Day, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, energyItemType, 2009-12-16, MWd, Megawatt-Day is used to measure energy generated in one day by a power-plant. Is commonly used to define fuel-burnup. A commonly used measure of fuel burnup is the fission energy release per unit mass of fuel., Customary, REC, 2021-02-16) -
[units_xml] list(GJ, Gigajoule, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, energyItemType, 2009-12-16, GJ, Billion Joules, SI, REC, 2021-02-16) -
[units_xml] list(MJ, Megajoule, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, energyItemType, 2009-12-16, MJ, Million Joules, SI, REC, 2021-02-16) -
[units_xml] list(TJ, Terajoule, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, energyItemType, 2009-12-16, TJ, Trillion Joules, SI, REC, 2021-02-16) -
[units_xml] list(PB, Petabyte, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, memoryItemType, 2009-12-16, PB, Petabytes of Memory per IEEE 1541-2002, Non-SI, REC, 2021-02-16) -

[units_xml] list(Mvar, Million Volt-ampere reactive, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, powerItemType, 2009-12-16, Mvar, In electric power transmission and distribution, Million volt-ampere reactive (Mvar) is a unit by which reactive power is expressed in an AC electric power system. Reactive power is the power that is wasted and not used to do work on the load., Customary, REC, 2021-02-16) -

[units_xml] list(MVA, MegaVolt-ampere, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, powerItemType, 2009-12-16, MVA, A megavolt-ampere (MVA) is the unit used for the apparent power in an electrical circuit, equal to the product of root-mean-square (RMS) voltage and RMS current. In direct current (DC) circuits, this product is equal to the real power (active power) in watts. Volt-amperes are useful only in the context of alternating current (AC) circuits., SI, REC, 2021-06-30) -

[units_xml] list(tCO2e, Metric tonnes of CO2 equivalent, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, ghgEmissionsItemType, 2021-08-09, tCO2e, Carbon dioxide equivalent is calculated for emissions other than carbon dioxide according to their global warming potential (GWP). As estimates of GWP may change over time, the UTR defines no fixed conversion rates., Non-SI, REC, 2021-06-30) -

[units_xml] list(ktCO2e, Thousand metric tonnes of CO2 equivalent, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, ghgEmissionsItemType, 2021-08-09, ktCO2e, Carbon dioxide equivalent is calculated for emissions other than carbon dioxide according to their global warming potential (GWP). As estimates of GWP may change over time, the UTR defines no fixed conversion rates., Non-SI, REC, 2021-06-30) -

[units_xml] list(MtCO2e, Million metric tonnes of CO2 equivalent, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, ghgEmissionsItemType, 2021-08-09, MtCO2e, Carbon dioxide equivalent is calculated for emissions other than carbon dioxide according to their global warming potential (GWP). As estimates of GWP may change over time, the UTR defines no fixed conversion rates., Non-SI, REC, 2021-06-30) -

[units_xml] list(GtCO2e, Thousand million metric tonnes of CO2 equivalent, http://www.xbrl.org/2009/utr, ghgEmissionsItemType, 2021-08-09, GtCO2e, Carbon dioxide equivalent is calculated for emissions other than carbon dioxide according to their global warming potential (GWP). As estimates of GWP may change over time, the UTR defines no fixed conversion rates., Non-SI, REC, 2021-06-30) -
